website_summaries.verdict: Surpasses the competitors in every way: comfort, stability, and support. You won't find a pair that has more to offer.
pros: Made of leather for long wear
Stretchable fabric makes them easy to remove
Thick rubber padding helps prevent blistering
cons: When new, they have a strong chemical smell, but this goes away over time

customer_reviews.title: Perfect workout gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are amazing. Before I got these, I used cheap Gold's Gym gloves. The difference in feel, support, comfort and everything else is NIGHT AND DAY.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, relieves pain, resulting in more frequent workouts!!
customer_reviews.text: I just received these yesterday and already have done one workout with my kettlebells. They are amazing, flexible, easy on and off and padded in just the right areas. My forefingers used to get bruised between knuckle and first joint (always seen the next day, along with joint stiffness and pain)... nothing today!! I feel I will be able to do more daily workouts (alternating exercises) now w/o the pain.
customer_reviews.author: bhyogini

customer_reviews.title: **Update**Professional look and feel
customer_reviews.text: Professional look and feel. I especially like the wrist support and padding. The anti slip grip and removal loops are icing on the cake. I work my gloves hard at the gym. I started with Harbinger gloves of all types and always came unseamed at the fingers. With elite that doesn’t seem to be a problem. I will update after several months of use. **Update** I purchased these gloves in August 2018...by December 2018 these gloves are falling apart where there is only single stitching. I only use them 3 times per week for my heavy lifting. Any chance the manufacturer will replace them? I will post after I contact the manufacturer and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: They fell apart after one workout
customer_reviews.text: I have replied to the vendor on this but haven't heard back yet. I may have to return them through Amazon for a refund. For reference, I have been working out for over 40 years, and have used many types of gloves in that time. I bought these in a medium size. My hand is roughly a 7 1/2. The left glove started falling apart after one workout! Also whilst the fingers fit well, both of the thumbs were so tight that the circulation to my thumb was seriously restricted. Lastly if you look closely at the center two fingers of the right glove you can see that they are sewn on crookedly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it tested and ripped just in six days
customer_reviews.text: These gloves were very comfortable but ripped after just 6 workouts. The glove ripped on the palms. I would not recommend these gloves. I guess Harbingers are better gloves for a cheaper price or rogue gloves. It was so surprising that Elite gloves were recommended as the best 2019 gloves, this makes you wonder how they even decide which ones are good. Harbingers lasted me over two years but then I am not a professional but I workout six days a week
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gloves were FANTASTIC for about 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: So these gloves are great gloves... while they last. Pretty quickly the padding on the heel of the left hand started tearing, but it wasn't awful. At about the three month mark, the seams started ripping and from month 5-6 (now) the leather deteriorated. Really disappointed, as they were initially amazing, and even as they broke down they provided good protection and support. But at 6 months I can no longer get them on without them falling apart. I do lift hard and heavy, but took care of them (warm water wash by hand, line dry) and really expected to get at least a year out of them, especially for the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Guggernaut

customer_reviews.title: Very close to perfect save the threading
customer_reviews.text: I'm neither a big guy or lift very heavy, but somehow I always manage to destroy whatever gloves I'm using, the previous two brands I've used were Adidas (total rubbish) and Harbinger (very hard wearing, but not very comfy). This particular glove set from "Grip Power Pads" it's very decent, but sadly after 3 months the have started coming apart, the bulk of the problem is that the stitching has simply worn out while the leather/fabric has been holding alright, so I've sewn what I can, and super-glued all the failing areas, I doesn't look as pretty now but should last a few more months. Maybe they should use Kevlar threading or whatever is stronger, that would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: GSC

customer_reviews.title: Unconfortable and expensive
customer_reviews.text: While the size is right there is SO much padding on the palms that it's hard to grip anything with confidence, and then they start cutting off the circulation. The removal loops should be further back so they won't limit your fingers like mittens do. Far more expensive than the Harbinger gloves I bought at the same time, and there's no comparison. The Harbingers remain my go-to work-out gloves. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For anyone serious about lifting, these gloves are right for you!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves for my husband for his fitness journey a year ago. He works almost everyday, and sometimes twice a day, while wearing these gloves. And he lifts heavy (sometimes very heavy) while working out. He loves these gloves and is constantly raving about them and their comfort, their grip, and even how easy they are to get off. He and I both would recommend these same workout gloves for anyone serious about working out. Pics of him with our family, using these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but not well made
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get through one workout and the gloves began to fall apart. After about 30-40 minutes of use, the stitching of the Velcro started to become unstitched as seen in the photos. I really wished the stitching was of better quality because the gloves were comfortable. Being that I have a wrist issue, a strong wrist strap for protection is an important feature that I need in a glove. I was able to get my money back when I sent the gloves back.
customer_reviews.author: JJ5

customer_reviews.title: Don’t hold up. *updated*
customer_reviews.text: Update: Gloves seams popped within a month and a half of use... These are the best lifting gloves that’s ive ever owned. Bought these about a month ago and water to wait to review. I lift hard about 5-6 days a week and these gloves are DURABLE. Not only are they holding up from constant use but they are very confortable and all the the pressure pads are in the right spot. These gloves are lifers...I will have a pair of these for the est of my life. Ps sizes run a bit small. Measure your hand and then go one size up.
customer_reviews.author: Mariam Gailani

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove but stitching is awful and weak
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear Harbinger gloves but decided to try these. I thought they run a little snug so I had to exchange them for bigger size, although the thumb would in glove was still tight. I do like the glove, the extra length on the fingers, the rubberized grip is nice and the wrap for the wrists within the glove. I work out 4x week for about 2hrs and within 2 weeks the stitching in the palm was coming undone, which I took pics and sent to seller. They did offer replacement but I’m sure the others would do the same. At this time I still have mixed feelings on these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Koda Mo

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Hold Up
customer_reviews.text: I lift 3x per week. I am not a power lifter so I do not put the gloves under extreme stress. After about 6 months the stitching started coming undone in both palms. I returned them and received a replacement pair under warranty. Less than a year later, the second pair have the same problem. Obviously, the stitching is too weak to hold up to constant use. Unfortunately, at this point they are out of warranty. These are not inexpensive gloves. I expected them to last longer than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Comfortable, and the Best Gloves on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a longtime supporter of Harbinger gloves for my workouts in the gym of the past 12 years but their quality has greatly diminished over the past few years. I found these gloves by Googling "Best weightlifting gloves" and have not been disappointed. The leather is super durable and the loops to pull them off if something I never knew I needed until having them! They're a little more expensive than other gloves on the market but I am certain these will last far longer than any gloves I've had in the past. If you're serious about lifting gloves that provide stability, comfort, and protection against blisters, buy these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph S.

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and Grip
customer_reviews.text: I am 70 and started lifting when I was 14. I am still in excellent condition. BW 154, BF 7%. Top 1 rep bench 280lbs. I have always bought the cheapest gloves, never giving gloves much importants. I recently bought these Elite's and I have to say they are the best gloves I have ever worn. I have a TFCC tear in both wrists and these gloves help support my wrists when lifting heavy. They are extremely comfortable and I look forward to wearing them when I go to the gym. They look great, feel great and really help with my over all grip. Love them and will buy again someday.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Delozier

customer_reviews.title: I like that it has the finger pull off tabs and ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many types of gloves. these are one of my favorites. I like that it has the finger pull off tabs and the strings between the finger for easy removal. I have ripped many gloves taking them off, this feature help eliminate that problem. Gloves are comfortable and well padded. These are probably tied for second as my favorite gloves(with no1 being discontinued years ago),.
customer_reviews.author: Detpete

customer_reviews.title: Second pair not as good as the first, rubber grip broke in less than a week...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these gloves that I've ordered and was disappointed to see that the rubber grip broke apart in less than a week. The first pair I ordered was great and lasted a long time. I like the fit and padding of these gloves, but have to say that the durability and quality is not what it used to be. Want to like them but wouldn't purchase again and can't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Solid gloves. Make sure you measure your hands.
customer_reviews.text: I have been lifting for over 20 years and have used owned about 15 different gloves. These gloves function well. The fit is accurate. The loops to remove them are excellent. The hand protection and wrist support is super. Measure both hands. I measured just one and was at the top limit of XL. The other hand is slightly bigger. They still work fine, just the one hand is a bit snug. I knocked off one star because a) the first pair shipped with a small hole. They did contact me and shipped a new pair and b) I feel they are a little pricey compared to other quality gloves I've owned in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: No more sore fingers!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so excited to have finally found a pair of gloves that I know will last more than a few months. These gloves have a fairly good fit with great palm padding and extend past the first joints of the fingers- frigging awesome for gripping iron dumbbells. My fingers did not fatigue but my arms did- that's the way it should be! These are built to last and happy to see a well made and stylish pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: RealLoveIs

customer_reviews.title: Great workout gloves - better than Bollingers...
customer_reviews.text: I've have many, many workout gloves! And these gloves are well made. The grip is great! I don't feel any slipping of the kind and it's quite comfortable when holding onto the Olympic bar...especially during bench pressing. The glove extends to mid finger what gives a better grip and prevents callouses in that area. I also like the padding near the finger where it meets the palm as it protects that area against wear. All in all great set of workout gloves. Yes - they are better than Bollinger!
customer_reviews.author: AHA-1211

customer_reviews.title: Best workout gloves I have ever owned!!!
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt these are the best workout gloves I have owned! The minute you take them out of the packaging, you know you have one helluva pair of workout gloves in your hands! The velcro wrist wrap gives great support. The grip and padding are almost tactical in their ruggedness. The price point for gloves like these are a great deal! I would recommend these gloves to anyone who is serious or even half serious about working out and wants to protect their hands and support their wrists!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Morano

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and feel...still waiting for replacement under warrenty
customer_reviews.text: Best workout glove I have owned to date, should last, and has a great look....the palm pads started to detach...so I contacted the seller...they said warranty was 1 year, bought them in February...was told to send the gloves back to them, and they would be replaced....sent them back 06/29/20....Because of COVID I expected some delay, today is July 30th and still waiting for replacement...I hope they come soon Pops
customer_reviews.author: Pops

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a few other name brands gloves, and this one by far is the best one for bench press. Because I bench almost everyday with heavy weights, having a pair of gloves with enough padding is a must. I highly recommend this gloves. The padding and wrist support are just right! The only improvement that I could think of is the length of the fingers that the glove could cover. Because I have long fingers, if there are options for people to choose gloves between long/short fingers, that would be awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Lover

customer_reviews.title: these glove look nice..
customer_reviews.text: these glove look nice...real nice....thats it...try doing a deadlift or a barbell row...or a wide grip pulldown.....they are horrible...i did less weight with them on cause i couldnt grip tight enough.....used cheap golds gym gloves right after...and my correct weight amount and reps were back...maybe with pushing exercises they may be fine...but not with pulling.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Shepardson

customer_reviews.title: these are way to bulky across the palm.
customer_reviews.text: As I read down through the reviews, I start to wonder what was I thinking. ***** for appearance ( if you want to look the part then these are for you) ***** for design ** for functionality (If you want a pair of work out gloves that are designed for training then pass them by )( I like the wrist strap ) absolutely hate how the glove feel when I wear them. way to tight in the fingers, the palm has this crap on it that stops you from flexing or closing your hand) * for the quality of the material
customer_reviews.author: tracy s

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for about a month now, and they are (so far) the best gloves I've ever owned. Padded in all the right places, with a wrist strap that has two velcro patches so the straps don't travel up your arm when working out. The pull-rings on the fingers make for easy removal. Overall excellent product. Hopefully they'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob & Robin

customer_reviews.title: Well padded globes
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves for carpal tunnel assist. High quality and heavily padded. Takes load off the wrists for dumbbells, pushups, etc. Only nit is that I don’t like the tabs to assist taking them off - they easily get caught on stuff in the gym - a hazard. I cut them off. But great gloves - my 2nd pair. Fit runs true to glove size in mens. Markkowaleski.com
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kowaleski

customer_reviews.title: so I'm going to have to give it a thumbs down the best ones so far are the Harbinger gloves which I ...
customer_reviews.text: Not even 2 months ago I purchase this gloves and 1 is already tore itself apart from the cushion, so I'm going to have to give it a thumbs down the best ones so far are the Harbinger gloves which I have already ordered another pair of gloves. I don't mind to spend money on a good product, but you buy and you learn.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Corona

customer_reviews.title: Overall, great workout glove
customer_reviews.text: So far, the gloves are holding up. I have owned them for a few weeks. They are a little on the bulky side and take a little getting used to. I primarily use them for “bar work” like pull/ups, muscle/ups, etc. Periodically, you will have to “hand wash” them because they will retain that “sweat smell.” When you do wash them, they will “color bleed,” but according to the manufacturer, that’s normal. Overall, they do a great job protecting your hands and the built-in wrist wraps are a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: C. Perry

customer_reviews.title: By far the best gym gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this gym gloves ever since I purchased it. This is by far the best gym gloves I have used. It gives great comfort and protection against calluses. And it is soft and extremely durable, a tough combination to find. I would highly recommend this to anyone working out with weights. I primarily use it for my home workouts with dumbbells. Very useful for working out dumbbells and barbells.
customer_reviews.author: Subhajit

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: These fit amazingly well. I have an issue that I bought 3X and the tag says 2X, but then the description says there are two completely different size charts, one for US and one for wherever these were manufactured. I just wish the globe would make a default and stay with that. It's like metric versus imperial. Use metric, for crying out loud, it's so much easier than imperial.
customer_reviews.author: Lycantis

customer_reviews.title: Quality gloves-Downsize if you are a woman
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. These are high quality leather gloves with double durable stitching. Did not want to order the pink girlie ones. The small were too big so ordered the XS and very happy with them. Well worth the price. Size down if you are a woman. You will be happy with these gloves. I workout 3-4 times a-week with weights and cross train.. it’s obvious immediately at first sight that these good grade gloves will hold up. Will keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: Marathon running Pharmacist

customer_reviews.title: Overally great lifting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these for over a month. They are strong but comfortable. Love the loops and thumb tag that make it easier to remove. Thumb protection is good too. They also look good and friends at the gym have admired and inquired about them. The wrist wrap part can feel a bit bulky especially if you plan to wear lifting hooks with them. Otherwise they serve as wrist protectors as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The glove itself fits very well, very good grip and padding. The problem is with the wrist wraps. The velcro does not hold well, and the straps stretch excessively especially when they get alittle wet. For this reason I constantly have to adjust the straps. I would purchase them again if the strap issue is addressed because the glove itself is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ucciardi III

customer_reviews.title: Decent gloves but have some issues!
customer_reviews.text: Nice padding in the palm, but the padding on the fingers make it difficult to grip the weights and will pinch your fingers. Fingers could be a little shorter. Easy to get on and off. Provides good support for the wrists!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer MR D

customer_reviews.title: My favorite workout glove
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement for my harbinger gloves. These are lasting just as long or longer than the more expensive harbinger ones, and the finger pulls are a great addition for getting them off. Very comfortable, with nice palm padding. Sturdy material and good design, that breathes and supports the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: John Paul Detty

customer_reviews.title: These are excellent! Very snug fit and great padding
customer_reviews.text: I have been lifting for about 15 years and have gone through several types of gloves, These are excellent! Very snug fit and great padding. My only chief complaint is that the length of the finger with the padding makes it more difficult to grip a barbell when doing heavy deadlifts (215lb+) because there is actually too much material for my fingers to secure a tighter grip. If you want a something more specific to power lifting I would recommend Harbinger that lacks the padding these have. Other than that, I love these gloves and recommend them to very active lifters.
customer_reviews.author: JKNFighter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance with price, quality and durability.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves because i was looking for something different (stylish appeal) fit and function. I took them tot he gym and gave them a run they were for me perfect for grip, my wrists were well supported and the construction was easily molded to my hands. I strongly recommend these gloves because they are easy to put on, built for a tough work out and easy to take off......great purchase.......will buy another surely....
customer_reviews.author: U Ramlochan

customer_reviews.title: Quick shipping and good communication. Item is very snug so as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Quick shipping and good communication. Item is very snug so as the description say of you are in between sizes get next size up, so I would suggest if you are with in1/4 inch of next size , choose next size. Outside of glove very soft, but some of the seems are a bit rough. Suggestion to manufacturers put more flexible material around the finger ends as the end sit right on knuckle and due to tightness of glove, it becomes very uncomfortable, let’s hope they stretch some.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Y.

customer_reviews.title: Superior design and padding
customer_reviews.text: These lifting gloves are superior to other types of gloves I've had in the past. They have great padding and provide exceptional support. The extra wide wrist wraps give great support for my wrists when doing resistance exercises and the lush padding really helps protect my fingers, which are prone to arthritic pain if lifting without these gloves. And the finger extenders that assist in taking the gloves off are very helpful. That has been a complaint with other lifting gloves, which were hard to pull off my hands when finishing a session. These extenders make taking the gloves off much easier. A very clever and convenient addition to a well designed lifting glove. I would highly recommend these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: satisfied customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. Ive been using them about a month now. I used the size chart. They were tight at first but broke in quickly. I have some arthritus in my wrists and thumbs and the wrist wrap is great. Was able to increase weight on the bench immediately due to confidence in my wrists. Unless they just fall appart I will deffinately buy again and recomend to anyone looking for a good quality pair of lifting gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Torn in a month
customer_reviews.text: It felt sturdy initially, but right after one month, palm side is torn and start showing padding inside it. You can see from the picture that it’s still very new. I used it daily, but only lifting around 65lb per gloves. Two star for good wrist protection and overall sturdy feeling.
customer_reviews.author: B. Shin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and started putting reps on them. They are excellent gloves and the true successor to the Harbinger gloves we all used to love. I've been lifting for 30 years, used lots of equipment, and shed tears over the demise of Harbinger. These have restored my faith in the marketplace. Really good product. Just an FYI - the pads start out a little too thick, but break in nicely after a few intense sessions.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cook

customer_reviews.title: A very good pair of weightlifting gloves for proper hands and wrists support.
customer_reviews.text: Yes Indeed. I am 67 years old and I have lifted weights for 51 years since I was 16 years old in 1969. This product gives palm support, wrist support and fingers support. I now have Rheumatoid Arthritis so lifting with support throughout my hands and wrists is critical. This is a very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Chris Gelenter

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves, but
customer_reviews.text: These are well constructed gloves, good materials, but they run really small, so tight to be uncomfortable. I first tried a size large, didn't fit, then tried x large couldn't see much difference. My hands aren't that big, I guess they will stretch after using
customer_reviews.author: franko65

customer_reviews.title: Bodybuilder's Gloves review
customer_reviews.text: I've just received the gloves and have not yet had a chance to use them for my workout routine. They fit comfortably and appear to be well made. I have created a short first impression review of these gloves. For further details see the video.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Gloves for Lifting
customer_reviews.text: Good fit and longer finger covers was what I was looking for and these gloves fit the bill. Excellent padding and wrist wraps help with all lifting. They are great when using dumbbells but also squatting,hip thrusts, dead lifts. Great product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gym gloves around
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through so many pairs of gloves over the years (seasoned, not old). These gloves are the most comfortable, durable gloves that I have ever owned! They are very well made, the padding on these gloves are so good that blisters are a thing of the past. I am not saying it will help you complete that 8th rep you were straining to put up on your last set but these are hands down the best gloves that I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Primetime 66

customer_reviews.title: Quality of the gloves is inferior
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves for their durability however after a few months of use the stitching is already coming apart as it would on cheaper quality Not at all happy with this product felt like I could’ve went to a discount store and got the same type of product for a fraction of the cost do yourself a favor and save your money these are not worth the price. They’re also not very good when lifting heavy weights such as deadlifts as they did not provide a good grip I still ended up using my hands while lifting
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels cheap, but will check back in a month
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to update this review in 1 month. I was initially unimpressed with the glove, it looked cheap, the leather felt thin, and the cushion on the palm looks like it would peel with a bad drop of a weight. I bought these to replace my Harbinger gloves that died after 4 months of almost daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Well made. Good design.
customer_reviews.text: Solidly made gloves. Only 4 workouts so far and breaking in nicely. My hand is 9'' and XL fits just right. Not sure about the wrist bands but that is a personal matter and probably would apply more to heavier weights. Grips the pull up bar well. I was skeptical of the loops and thumb tab thinking they would get in the way but they are a brilliant idea. Only 4 stars because it is too early to judge durability but I like them enough to buy a second pair for my son-in-law.
customer_reviews.author: Col Ken

customer_reviews.title: Best Gloves. Period!
customer_reviews.text: Utilized many gloves over 30 years of training in every discipline (Weights, bags, weapons, etc). I've tried them all from the no name to the industry leaders. The Elite Leather Gym Gloves with Built in 2" Wide Wrist Wraps are by far the best gloves I ever used and are versatile for many applications. My pair is now 2 years old and are used several times a week and they're still great. No tears, leather soft, and they still provide the protection, support and grip needed for the most demanding workouts. It's very rare for a product to match the mfr claims, but these gloves are truly the best of the best. Thank you for a great product! Scott B
customer_reviews.author: SCB

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: I have had these gloves for about 3 weeks now, which means they have been through 10-12 workouts. No issues with durability. Padding on the palms still looks brand new! Comfortable fit and no rough seams or edges on the interior portions. Fingers have loops to aid in removal, but also little "pockets" on the backside of the middle and ring fingers that you can use the two fingers of your other hand to help take off, which is very helpful and a great idea I had never seen before. Much better quality glove than you will probably be able to find currently on the shelves of your average sporting goods store.
customer_reviews.author: C S

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best quality gloves you'll find on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: These Grip Power Pad gym gloves are pretty amazing. I bought them because my wrists were starting to hurt during my lifting routines and I needed some support, and these gloves were the perfect find! They are very comfortable and the wrist straps provide great support to the wrists. Within just a couple of days my wrists had ceased to hurt and I was back to my usual routine. You can immediately tell they are very strong quality and are a lot sturdier than most of the other gloves available here. They are WELL worth the price and I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos G

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Loves these gloves! The padding is thick enough that I no longer have palm pain from heavy weight. I also like the wrist support. That was my first review 11 months ago. Just bought my second pair. The first pair lasted 11 months of 6-7 days a week use. And up to two workouts a day. These new ones feel great. Love the padding.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dwornik

customer_reviews.title: I do a lot of weights 4x/ week and so far this is the best work out gloves I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I don't write a review to a product that I bought unless I have been using it for at least 3 months. I have this gloves for 5 months now; I do a lot of weights 4x/ week and so far this is the best work out gloves I ever had, used to have several harbinger gloves in the past. This gives me good grip for stability, hand and wrist support when I do my routines.
customer_reviews.author: Tisoy101

customer_reviews.title: I love Best Grip gym gloves
customer_reviews.text: I am dedicated to weight training and have used a variety of weight lifting gloves over the years. I've used well-known brands and some lesser-known brands. I purchased my first pair of Best Grip gloves a couple of years ago and have been impressed with the quality and durability of the gloves. So, when I needed more gloves this year, there was no doubt that Best Grip would be my choice. So I purchased another pair recently and used them for the first time yesterday. These have the same quality and I expect them to hold up to my strenuous weight training routine for the next couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Happy with the purchase. Although the fingers are longer than I'd like them to be (looks like little nubs hanging out the gloves haha). Took me a bit to get used to, but definitely longer fingers than any other gloves I've ever owned
customer_reviews.author: sean hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Better get a bigger than recommend size
customer_reviews.text: Way damn smaller than sized,WAAAY SMALLER,now stuck with a useless pair of gloves
customer_reviews.author: Billy Harless

customer_reviews.title: Bad sewing in one place
customer_reviews.text: The seam in one place separated. I had to sew it. It was the right size, not wet, and not abused. Otherwise, they are my favorite from 40 years at a public gym. My hands ached until they were "broke in". They will stain your clothes when wet. I recommend washing them by hand prior to use. After touch up sewing, I've worn them daily without issue. I hate to rate them a 3 due to minor seam separation, but that is a quality issue and most people would discard them.
customer_reviews.author: Young's Farm

customer_reviews.title: A quality workout glove!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves after carefully checking out all the choices available. I wanted a high quality glove and was willing to pay more. The fit, quality leather and composition was all there. I'm happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: USGI

customer_reviews.title: The only gym gloves you'll need
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Large black gloves that I received and I have had them for a month of wear and tear and they still look good as new. They smell great and are very comfortable! I only like what I can comfortably and I can even use the gloves while biking so that I have better grip while maneuvering.
customer_reviews.author: Austyn Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money, look no further
customer_reviews.text: As an amateur learning my way into workouts I was looking to acquire an extra pair of workout gloves. I was decently satisfied with my existing $15-20 gloves which is all I really knew about. The Grip Power Pads' much higher price accompanied by the good reviews got me curious. I've used them for a couple of days now and can say that I am delighted - they are what the reviews say - much higher quality, leather, well built. I don;t think I'll destroy these any time soon, but beyond durability these will make me feel more confident. Give these a try, won't regret.
customer_reviews.author: Chandrika Tripathy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have only had them for a few days but so far they hold well. They feel strong and fit just right. The stitching on one thumb has started to come off and I have had to repair it. On dumb bells with thicker bars, the grip feels weak but they are great on thinner bars.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Firstly I do not like to write reviews however I will done for this. First thing I noticed with these gloves are how tightly they fit which isn't a bad thing but if it's not something that you're used too you would say it's uncomfortable. The textile feel isn't the best however it does for some strange reason assist with your grip strength. I have only had these for about 2 weeks and that's enough time to see what the outcome will be. Let's just say I will be getting another pair as backup.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin S.

customer_reviews.title: WEIGHT LIFTING & BODYBUILDING ESSENTIALS IN ONE Gym glove enhance my grip
customer_reviews.text: They are Easy to take off. Unlike other lifting gloves, the Grip Power Pads® are easy to remove, offering two convenient options: grip the loops on the 2nd and 4th fingers to pull; or grip the tab on the side of the thumb, 3rd, and 5th fingers to pull. The wrist support is amazing! No more calluses and blisters! The two-tone rubber padding adds an additional layer of insulation and enhances grip strength to improve safety and prevent abrasions, burns, calluses, and blisters. I Get more out of your workout. The advanced technology and design make it possible for me to give every rep out of my workout! The sizing is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Vendor is not very responsive
customer_reviews.text: So these gloves are great gloves... while they last. Pretty quickly the padding on the heel of the left hand started tearing, but it wasn't awful. I used some glue to hold in place. found out the pair comes with a one year replacement. I sent my pair back (unfortunately didn't use a tracking number my bad) vendor just claims he didn't get them, so unfortunately I cant prof otherwise but find it a little hard to believe they just got lost in the mail as I sent them within NY state same as the vendors location.
customer_reviews.author: Kfir Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Ok, removal hooks ripped off after one use
customer_reviews.text: I love Grip Power Pad products. I have purchased 6 pair the past couple years. Only buy more because my dog keeps eating them. This pair I just got. Used once, and when taking off the hooks you’re supposed to pull on to remove ripped right off. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: mdb_nola

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, comfortable and excellent wrist support.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. I was looking for something to replace my old weightlifting gloves from 30 years ago. My old gloves were Harbinger's and they were top notch, but that is how they made them 30 years ago. I wanted something that had good padding, durability (these are still only 2 workouts old now, so we will have to wait and see) and they had to have excellent wrist support. I wear them mostly for bench press and just set a PR at 350 lbs last night wearing these gloves. This is a promising start. The only remaining question is how will they last.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Laferriere

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to a friend who is a serious weight lifter. He loves these gloves and says he has never had gloves that offered a cushion and fit like these. He is very happy and so I am, that I chose Elite!
customer_reviews.author: astro

customer_reviews.title: Great workout gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great workout gloves. I had a defective pair and the company came through and sent another. I would recommend though to go up a size, eg if you take large go up to an extra large. These gloves give the maximum protection/padding to hands.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line weightlifting gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are similar to the old Harbinger gloves with the rubber padding and inserts. But these are even better since they have wrist wraps with strong double Velcro enclosure and pull off loops and tabs to assist with removing them after finishing a workout! They don’t smell and the color doesn’t run. Have put these through some heavy workouts already and they have handled the task. They are true to size based off of the sizing chart recommendations and are snug right out of the bag, they loosen up just enough when you start to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in them tearing so quickly. Maybe buy from manufacturer directly.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return first pair after a month's use of 2-3x a week use. 2nd pair only last 1 use. Both ripped. Very disappointed because gym buddies swear by these gloves. Best gloves I've ever used. Just disappointed that they didn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Jm

customer_reviews.title: These gloves are durable.
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a fan of Harbinger gloves until I was running through a pair every 3 months. Quality has just really gone down hill. I picked these gloves up over a year ago and they are still going strong. No pads tearing out, no stitching unraveling, and no Velcro giving up the ghost. I have found my new favorite gloves. When these eventually give out (which may be another year or more at this rate) I will be happy to pick up another pair and support this company.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy VanZant

customer_reviews.title: Great Glvoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these earlier this week and they have been impressive so far. I love the cushioning and haven't found a pair of gloves with better support (cushioning). They make lifting heavy weights easier. I was annoyed at first by the small loops they put on the gloves to help get them off, but they have been useful after a hard workout. When the gloves arrived they fit a little tight, but after a week of wearing them they are loosening up a bit and a lot easier to get on and off. I will never buy another type of gloves again. These put Harbinger gloves to shame! Looking forward to my next pair already!
customer_reviews.author: John Griesse

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit for Dumbbell Workouts & More
customer_reviews.text: Gloves arrived on time and nicely packaged have used for a week and they feel great. Used them and the grip around the dumbbell was comfortable. When they wear out I will be purchasing another pair. Love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Abundio Adriano

customer_reviews.title: Not that durable
customer_reviews.text: After just 40 days of usage it starts to break down , tears all over my palms even though I don’t lift heavy weights , for the price I paid I was expecting a better quality
customer_reviews.author: Chris85

customer_reviews.title: Previous pairs were great. Most current reorder is falling apart on day 1.
customer_reviews.text: Ive ordered these same gloves once a year for 3 years. The first 2 years they were great. They were long lasting and I would have definitely recommended them. The last pair I ordered 1 month ago started coming apart after 1 use. On the 2nd use parts of padding fell off the palm of one. Im not sure if I got a bad pair or if the quality is lower now, but please beware since they are so expensive. I guess I will try something different next time.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisFL

customer_reviews.title: 1 month 11 days ... falling apart
customer_reviews.text: I do not like that these gloves are falling apart after just 1 month and 11 days! The rubber section on the palm is coming apart from the stitching. And... To late for a return!
customer_reviews.author: M. Pilcher

customer_reviews.title: good palm padding
customer_reviews.text: I use the gloves for weight training. I am older and keep up the training, but my hands are pretty thin and need a good bit of padding. These were perfect for that. I am not fond of the wrist wrap but it's not terrible. I'm sure other folks, mainly big guys ( I'm a 5'2" woman) get a lot of use from that feature. All in all I'm glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Susan FtL

customer_reviews.title: Price increase
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite gloves that I have used over the years. I lift a lot and normally end up replacing them every six months. I do not mind that as I get my money's worth. However, I am concerned about the recent price increase (?). My last pair was $42, and this pair was $58. Why the increase????
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J.

customer_reviews.title: Best ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best gloves I have ever owned - and have had all the name brands. These are very well constructed, firm, well padded, great wrist protection - and the ergonomics of getting them off are superb. Bought a little on the small side and great tight, firm fit. I hope they wear well. I need the extra palm padding and these are great.
customer_reviews.author: JFB

customer_reviews.title: Great Support Seems Durable So Far
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great. I have only used them a couple of weeks but they seem to be holding up well. The level of support is better than any other glove I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Smoothman8270

customer_reviews.title: The best gloves I ever had
customer_reviews.text: At first I had doubt because Elite Leather Gym Gloves was more expensive than my bouget, but when I received them I absolutely loved them. The most interesting thing for me is pull off tabs for easy to pull on & off. It is really helpful specially after exercise when your hands sweat. The quality is perfect. it is a combination of strength and comfort. I strongly recommend these Gloves because quite thickly padded which can make the grip quite different to bare hands. Good wrist support. just order it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Reza Rezaeikhosravi

customer_reviews.title: EXTREMELY surprised by the quality
customer_reviews.text: These are great weight lifting gloves, ive had over a dozen pairs from cheap brands and even Everlast ones, which should probably be renamed to "DoesntReallyLastLongerThanTwoMonths" . I feel im finally able to lift heavier thanks to the ultra grip these gloves provide. You will literally not feel a thing, leaving you to focus on proper form and execution.
customer_reviews.author: David N.

customer_reviews.title: Overall definitely would recommend these gloves
customer_reviews.text: What I liked about the gloves was the amazing grip quality and comfort of the gloves, I generally workout 4 to 5 times per week and my previous workout gloves were pretty much done in so I started looking for something with better quality, durability, and better grip, these gloves pretty much hit all those marks I was looking for and I’m happy with my purchase definitely would recommend this brand to my friends
customer_reviews.author: JESUS

customer_reviews.title: on a different level than anyone else
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are on a different level than anyone else. Worth every penny. Extra padding, the thickest padding I have ever seen, makes it very comfortable to wear. Movement is not compromised by the padding and still do a great job. After getting this, I feel like to throw away all my other gloves. Once you experienced the best, you cannot go back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very High Quality!
customer_reviews.text: These are the nicest weight lifting gloves that I have ever used, and I've been through alot! Very soft but with a rugged design. Grips are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied - glad I spent time to find these
customer_reviews.text: I spent quite some time looking for good gloves at a great price. These gloves feel comfortable. The stitching and build is high quality. They are very protective and they help me to lift. The padding is very thick compare to my previous pair of gloves. This is important to me since my hands are not naturally thick and I quickly hit a low ceiling without them. I highly recommend these. The pads are also pretty sophisticated and located at ideal spots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stitching holds up great. This is my 2nd pair of these
customer_reviews.text: Ive been working out every other day for the past 3 years, lifting weights, machines, etc... Ive gone through many pairs of gloves. Grip power pads gloves last longer than all the others I've tried. These are well made, stitching holds up great. This is my 2nd pair of these, first pair probably lasted 4 months or so, before holes wore through...... normal wear and tear, to be expected. I would recommend these, way better than any others I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: SteveS BKNY

customer_reviews.title: Nah
customer_reviews.text: gloves are too bulky and meaty, hard to keep grip of dumbbells.
customer_reviews.author: John Knocko

customer_reviews.title: ... weightlifter for the last 35years and it feels so good to finally find a pair of gloves that serve ...
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid weightlifter for the last 35years and it feels so good to finally find a pair of gloves that serve my exact needs. The wrist support, the extra padding in the palms, the sizes for larger hands and the ease of removing the gloves make purchasing this item a no-brainer. The cost is comparable to any other glove of it's kind, but it's the quality of workmanship and the dedication of the company itself to help their customers that truly sets them apart.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Costello

customer_reviews.title: Total Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Total crap 4 months of use and the rubber padding on both palms is falling apart. Not worth $50 . Save your money
customer_reviews.author: Typhoon1492

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Build quality and fit after right on. These aren't for supper heavy lifting, so don't expect that. Wrist support is great for a variety of exercises. Pull tabs make removal a cinch. I'm very very happy with these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves, but didn't last a year
customer_reviews.text: At first when I received the gloves they were perfect. The quality on these is amazing. And the padding is like no other. My calluses instantly reduced. But the other day I was pulling them off my hands and the loop broke off. Granted its almost been a year and I use the gym 3-4 times a week, but something like this should last longer then a year...
customer_reviews.author: E34innnn

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Arguably theses gloves are the most comfortable I have ever had. I have been working out for over 40 years plus and they have good stability as well as comfort. The multiple ways to remove the gloves is a nice feature. When you first use the gloves you will notice some black fuzz on your hands from the inside of the glove, it goes away after a few uses. They also enhance your grip on the weight bars. So far I would highly recommend these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have the best padding ive seen on any gym gloves. it feels extremely comfortable with lots of padding and when working out you dont feel like theres anything in your hands. Completely helps with having a better grip. you wont regret buying these at all.
customer_reviews.author: raunaq sandhu

customer_reviews.title: Wrong description
customer_reviews.text: Size chart is wrong. And out of the package you could see loose threads.
customer_reviews.author: LCN

customer_reviews.title: Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return these because I decided not to buy a weight bench so I didn’t need them. But I couldn’t help but try them on because they looked so cool and I was curious....if in the future I need weight lifting gloves, these are the ones I will purchase. Again.
customer_reviews.author: patricia barks

customer_reviews.title: Sewing breaking apart
customer_reviews.text: Product used for 2 months and glove sewing breaking apart. It’s a shame because the glove padding is plentiful.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

product_meta.title: Elite Leather Gym Gloves with Built in 2" Wide Wrist Wraps Best Grip & Design for Weightlifting Power Lifting Bodybuilding & Strength Training Workout Exercises
feature_bullets: 2 POWER LIFTING & BODYBUILDING ESSENTIALS IN ONE Gym gloves enhance your grip while the 2-inch wide, 25-inch Leather long wrist wraps provide stability and reduce your risk of injury. Why buy two pieces of workout gear when you can get the benefits of both with one comfortable, high quality leather glove?

SO EASY TO TAKE OFF Unlike other lifting gloves, Grip Power Pads gloves are easy to remove and offer two different removal options. Either grip the loops on the 2nd and 4th fingers to pull or grip the tab on the side and the thumb, 3rd & 5th fingers to pull

NO MORE CALLUSES AND BLISTERS! Blue two tone rubber padding adds extra insulation and enhances grip strength to improve safety and prevent abrasions, burns, calluses and blisters! You'll be able to give every rep your all with these gym gloves
MADE FOR A PERFECT FIT Offered in Small, Medium, Large & Extra Large; Consult the sizing chart to find the right option for your hands!

LOVE THEM OR GET YOUR MONEY BACK! Our workout gym gloves are handmade from luxury quality leather! We're so sure you’ll love them that we offer a 60-day money-back satisfaction guarantee on ever pair! In addition, there is a 1-year Mail In & replacement warranty on each pair of our weight lifting gym gloves sold
